result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

ADDRESS INFO for Ruben S. Coates

Case Called: 8:51am. INCLUDES 14CM2058, 15CM251. Clerk: Denise.  State appears by ADA Mike Puerner. Deft appears in person w/Atty Andrew Morgan. *VRCW. Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights & Counsel filed. State moves to DI ct 1 (battery/domestic/repeater) 14CM2058 - crt grants. State moves to delete domestic and repeater and amend language to "otherwise dc" in ct 2 in 14CM2058 - crt grants. State moves to DRI 15CM251- crt grants. PLEA: NO CONTEST - amend ct 2 ("otherwise dc") 14CM2058. Crt advises def of rights & penalties & ques def to understanding.  Crt finds plea & waiver freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.  Statements by Stat & Defense re: huber.  COURT ORDERS: 30 days MCJ w/huber if eligible pursuant to jail criteria- work, work search and/or child care; to commence w/in 45 days; DNA Surcharge; Court Costs. Adjourned: 9:02am.
Plea hearing on April 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Shall have his/her fingerprints and photograph taken at the Sheriff's Dept.
